description: Ms. codex. Title from preamble (fol. 1b, l. 4-5). 23 lines per page. Written in thick small naskh in black ink with use of red. Glazed European paper. Marginal annotations by another hand. Inscription on fol. 1a mentioning the number of ḥadīth contained in this text. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (faulty). Inscription in Roman script on a spine label and on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Y21" (repeated on the same pastedown in red pencil, "21Y". Collation: Paper, fol. 309 ; 1-7¹⁰ 8⁸ (+1, fol. 73) 9¹⁰ 10¹² 11-15¹⁰ 16¹² 17¹⁰ 18⁸ 19-30¹⁰ 31⁸ ; catchword on the verso of each leaf ; the quires are numbered using Arabic numerals ("al-awwal min [---]" on first quire). binding_note: Golden brown leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers, fore-edge flap and envelope flap. Both covers are similarly blind tooled and stamped with a central mandorla and an outer frame consisting of single fillets surrounding a s-shape running pattern. Similar outer frame on the fore-edge flap and on the envelope flap, with a round stamp on the point of the later. Yellow paper pastedowns. Disbound.
